brief_summary.textblock:
The laser areas treated with biocellulose sheet from coconut juice containing
      anti-hyperpigmentation agent ("biocellulose mask", "Farhorm®") heal faster than vaseline
      ointment which is a standard treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Biocellulose Sheet Containing Anti-hyperpigmentation Agent ("Biocellulose Mask", "Farhorm®") in Patients Receiving Laser Treatment

detailed_description.textblock:
Volar surface at upper arm (2X2 cm) on both sides were treated with semi ablative, 1,550 nm
      Erbium: glass fractional laser. Biocellulose sheet from coconut juice containing
      anti-hyperpigmentation agent ("biocellulose mask","Farhorm®")was applied for 20 min on one
      side and the other side was treated with vaseline ointment. The redness, skin hydration and
      skin pigmentation were evaluated at that area before laser, immediately after laser and
      after applying the treatment.  These parameters were compared between treatment (area
      treated with Biocellulose sheet from coconut juice containing anti-hyperpigmentation agent,
      "biocellulose mask", "Farhorm®") and control (vaseline ointment).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 20-50 years old

          -  No skin problem such as inflammation, fresh wounds

          -  Not receive laser treatment during last 3 months

          -  No history of smoking or alcohol drinking

          -  No allergy to licorice extract, Vit C, Vit E, arbutin or stearyl glycyrrhetinate

          -  Willing to participate in this study and can comply with study protocol

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Has history of hyperallergic reaction

          -  Has wound(s) on face during last 4 weeks

          -  Has history of eczema, psoriasis during last 6 months

          -  Has laser treatment during last month

          -  Use steroid, antibiotic, anti-inflammatory drugs or antihistamine during 3 days
             before recruiting

          -  Had major surgery during last 12 months

          -  Has history of cancer during last 12 months

          -  Pregnant or lactation

facility.name: Department of Pharmacy Practice, Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences, Chulalongkorn Unviersity

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Biocellulose Sheet From Coconut Juice Containing Anti-hyperpigmentation Agent ("Biocellulose Mask", "Farhorm®") in Patients Receiving Laser Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: The skin pigmentation immediately after laser therapy and after using biocellulose mask
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from immediately after laser treatment and 30 min after laser and treatment with mask

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
